page.title: 05The Choirs of Stithians
page.content: Stithians Male voice choir was formed in 1947, and the ladies choir in 1966. Both choirs have about forty members consisting of adults of different ages from teenagers to senior citizens. Stithians Male voice choir is well known throughout Cornwall. They practice at Stithians church hall every week. The furthest they have been is Wales. They were going to the U.S.A. but at the last moment the trip was cancelled, due to the cost. Their performance in the 1OOO Voices Concert, at the Royal Albert Hall in London, was videoed. They have been recorded by Sentinel record company. The Male voice choir goes to the Princess Pavilion at Falmouth, every two weeks, during the Summer to sing with a guest soloist. The ladies choir have also been recorded by Sentinel.
